mlp

Class PomTaggedExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • mlp.PomTaggedExpression

  • public class PomTaggedExpression
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a POM-tagged math expression, which is a tree-like recursive structure, much like a parse tree, but it is not limited to being a parse tree in the conventional sense. The modeled expression can be a single basic math term, an arithmetic expression, a logic/boolean expression, a math construct (e.g., matrix, vector, set, a sigma-structure, a theory, ...), etc.

    The root of the tree-structure of a PomTaggedExpression object is a MathTerm object, which can have children (called components), where each child is itself a PomTaggedExpression object. Much like any MathTerm object, a PomTaggedExpression object can also have expression-level (unnamed) tags and (named) features. One of the unnamed tags is the primary tag, and the other unnamed tags are called secondary tags.

    It should be noted that the MathTerm root can be empty, and so can be the MathTerm of any node. Also, due to the recursive structure, each node (which represents a MathTerm object) can have its own individual tags and features, and each subtree (e.g., each sub-expression) can have its own sub-expression level tags and features. The tags, even the primary ones, can be empty.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PomTaggedExpression

        public PomTaggedExpression()
        Constructs an empty PomTaggedExpression object, that is, an empty tree, with no tags or features.

      • PomTaggedExpression

        public PomTaggedExpression(MathTerm root)
        Constructs a PomTaggedExpression object that is a one-node tree. The only tags and features are those of the root.
        Parameters:
        root - the MathTerm object that is the root of the tree. If root is null, a tagless and featureless MathTerm object with an empty String as its underlying term is created as the tree root.

      • PomTaggedExpression

        public PomTaggedExpression(MathTerm root,
                           java.lang.String... exprTags)
        Constructs a PomTaggedExpression object that is a one-node tree. The constructed object has the specified tags as expression-level tags.
        Parameters:
        root - the MathTerm object that is the root of the tree. If root is null, a tagless and featureless MathTerm object with an empty String as its underlying term is created as the tree root.
        exprTags - zero or more expression-level tags. The first of those tags, if any, is treated as the primary tag, and the rest of the tags are treated as secondary tags.

      • PomTaggedExpression

        public PomTaggedExpression(MathTerm root,
                           java.lang.String exprTag,
                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> exprSecondaryTags)
        Constructs a PomTaggedExpression object that is a one-node tree. The constructed object has the specified first tag as its primary expression-level tag, while the other specified tags are the expression-level secondary tags.
        Parameters:
        root - the MathTerm object that is the root of the tree. If root is null, a tagless and featureless MathTerm object with an empty String as its underlying term is created as the tree root.
        exprTag - the primary expression-level tag.
        exprSecondaryTags - the secondary expression-level tags

    • Method Detail

      • setRoot

        public void setRoot(MathTerm root)
        Sets or changes the root node to the specified root.
        Parameters:
        root - a MathTerm object that will become the root of the tree of the underlying object. If root is null, a tagless and featureless MathTerm object with an empty String as its underlying term is used instead.

      • setTag

        public void setTag(java.lang.String exprTag)
        Sets or changes the primary tag of this expression to exprTag
        Parameters:
        exprTag - the tag that will become the primary tag of the underlying modeled expression

      • setSecondaryTags

        public void setSecondaryTags(java.util.List<java.lang.String> exprSecondaryTags)
        Sets or changes the secondary tags of this expression to exprSecondaryTags
        Parameters:
        exprSecondaryTags - a list tags that will become the secondary expression-level tags of the underlying object.

      • setSecondaryTags

        public void setSecondaryTags(java.lang.String... exprSecondaryTags)
        Sets or changes the secondary tags of this expression to the specified exprSecondaryTags
        Parameters:
        exprSecondaryTags - zero or more tags that will become the secondary expression-level tags of the underlying object.

      • setComponents

        public void setComponents(java.util.List<PomTaggedExpression> components)
        Sets the components of this expression (i.e., the subtrees of the root of the underlying object) to the specified list. Any prior subtrees of the root are cleared first.
        Parameters:
        components - a list of PomTaggedExpression objects which will become the subtrees of the root of the underlying object.

      • setComponents

        public void setComponents(PomTaggedExpression... components)
        Sets the components of this expression (i.e., the subtrees of the root of the underlying object) to the specified components. Any prior subtrees of the root are cleared first.
        Parameters:
        components - zero or more PomTaggedExpression objects which will become the subtrees of the root of the underlying object.

      • addComponent

        public boolean addComponent(PomTaggedExpression c)
        Adds the specified component to this expression object. If you want to add the component to a specified position in the list of components/subtrees, use addComponent(int i, PomTaggedExpression c) instead.
        Parameters:
        c - the component to be added
        Returns:
        true if the adding was successful.

      • addComponent

        public boolean addComponent(MathTerm mt)
        Adds a new component made up of the single specified MathTerm
        Parameters:
        mt - the MathTerm object that will make up the new PomTaggedExpression object that will be added to the list of components.
        Returns:
        true if the adding was successful

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(int i,
                         PomTaggedExpression c)
        Inserts the specified component at the specified position in the list of components. Shifts the component currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent components to the right.
        Parameters:
        i - the position at the which the new component is to be added
        c - the component to be added at the specified position

        Parameters:
        i - the position at the which the new single-MathTerm component is to be added
        mt - the MathTerm object that will make up the new PomTaggedExpression object to be inserted

      • isNamedFeature

        public boolean isNamedFeature(java.lang.String key)
        Indicates whether the specified string is the name of an expression-level feature of the underlying object
        Parameters:
        key - a potential feature name for the underlying expression
        Returns:
        true if the specified parameter is a feature of the underlying expression

      • isNamedFeature

        public boolean isNamedFeature(java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.String value)
        Indicates whether the specified (name,value) pair forms the name and value of an expression-level feature of the underlying expression object.
        Parameters:
        key - a potential feature name for the underlying expression object
        value - a potential value for the specified feature
        Returns:
        true if the specified key-value pair are the name-value pair of an actual feature of the underlying math term

      • getFeatureValue

        public java.lang.String getFeatureValue(java.lang.String featureName)
        Returns the value of the specified feature of the underlying expression object
        Parameters:
        featureName - a potential feature name for the underlying expression
        Returns:
        the value of the specified feature name, if it exists. Otherwise, it returns null.

      • addNamedFeature

        public boolean addNamedFeature(java.lang.String featureName,
                               java.lang.String featureValue)
        Inserts the featureName-featureValue pair if the specified feature name is not null and no feature with the specified name already exists. Otherwise, this new name-value pair will not be inserted, and the method returns false.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be added
        featureValue - the value of the feature to be added
        Returns:
        true if the specified feature does not exist, its name is not null, and the feature was inserted successfully

      • setNamedFeature

        public java.lang.String setNamedFeature(java.lang.String featureName,
                                        java.lang.String featureValue)
        Inserts the feature featureName-featureValue pair if no feature with the specified name already exists. If a feature with the same name already exists, this method changes the value of that feature to the specified value. If the specified feature name is null, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be set
        featureValue - the value of the feature to be set
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified name, or null if there was no mapping for that name. (A null return can also indicate that the map previously associated null with the key, if the implementation supports null values.)

      • removeNamedFeature

        public java.lang.String removeNamedFeature(java.lang.String featureName)
        Removes the specified expression-level feature if it exists. If the feature does not exist, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be removed
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with the specified feature name, or null if there was no mapping for it.

      • isTag

        public boolean isTag(java.lang.String maybeTag)
        Checks if the specified input String is one of the tags (primary or secondary) of the underlying expression.
        Parameters:
        maybeTag - a potential tag
        Returns:
        true if the parameter is one of the tags (primary or secondary)

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if the object is empty, that is, if its root is empty, and there are no components and there are no tags and no named features.
